pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:0.5.eng: 21. The training rule on the instruction

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantā lābhino honti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.2.eng: At that time the senior monks who were instructing the nuns received robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.3.eng: When the monks from the group of six found out about this,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.4.pli: “etarahi kho, āvuso, therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantā lābhino honti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.5.eng: they thought, “Well then, let’s instruct the nuns.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.6.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—“amhepi, bhaginiyo, upasaṅkamatha; mayampi ovadissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.6.eng: They then went to the nuns and said, “Come to us, Sisters, and we too will instruct you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.7.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.7.eng: Soon afterwards those nuns went to the monks from the group of six,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.8.pli: upasaṅkamitvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.9.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojesuṃ—“gacchatha, bhaginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.9.eng: But after giving just a short teaching, those monks spent the day on worldly talk. They then dismissed the nuns, saying, “Go, Sisters.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhagavā etadavoca—“kacci, bhikkhuniyo, ovādo iddho ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10.eng: The nuns went to the Buddha and bowed, and the Buddha said to them, “Nuns, I hope the instruction was effective?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.11.eng: “Sir, how could the instruction be effective?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.12.pli: Ayyā chabbaggiyā parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojesun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.12.eng: After giving just a short teaching, the monks from the group of six spent the day on worldly talk, and then dismissed us.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.13.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened those nuns with a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.14.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.14.eng: The nuns bowed, circumambulated the Buddha with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.15.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.15.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks from the group of six:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you acted like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.19.eng: “Foolish men, how could you act like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.22.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.23.eng: “Monks, you should appoint an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.23.comm: “Should” renders anujānāmi. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.24.eng: And this is how he should be appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.25.eng: First a monk should be asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.26.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.26.eng: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.27.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.28.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.28.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.30.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.31.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.32.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunovādakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.32.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.33.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.34.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.35.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.36.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.37.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.38.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunovādakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.38.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.39.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.40.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.41.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.41.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.42.pli: Atha kho bhagavā chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.42.eng: Then, after rebuking the monks from the group of six in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.43.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.43.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.44.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu asammato bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.44.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has not been appointed instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.45.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.45.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena therā bhikkhū sammatā bhikkhuniyo ovadantā tatheva lābhino honti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.1.eng: After being appointed to do so, the senior monks who instructed the nuns still received robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.2.eng: When they found out about this, the monks from the group of six said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.3.pli: “etarahi kho, āvuso, therā bhikkhū sammatā bhikkhuniyo ovadantā tatheva lābhino honti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.4.pli: Handāvuso, mayampi nissīmaṃ gantvā aññamaññaṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ sammannitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.4.eng: “Well then, let’s go outside the monastery zone, appoint each other as instructors of the nuns, and then instruct them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.5.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū nissīmaṃ gantvā aññamaññaṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ sammannitvā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—“mayampi, bhaginiyo, sammatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.5.eng: After doing just that, they again went to the nuns and said, “Sisters, we too have been appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.6.eng: Come to us, and we will instruct you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.7.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.7.eng: Once again the nuns went to the monks from the group of six and everything unfolded as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.8.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojesuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.10.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.12.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhagavā etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.15.pli: Ayyā chabbaggiyā parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojesun”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.16.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.17.pli: atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.18.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.18.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks from the group of six:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.19.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.19.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you acted like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.22.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhunīnaṃ parittaññeva dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā divasaṃ tiracchānakathāya vītināmetvā uyyojessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.22.eng: “Foolish men, how could you act like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.25.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ sammannituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26.eng: “Monks, you may appoint a monk who possesses eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26.comm: This set of eight qualities is also found at AN 8.52:2.1.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.27.pli: Sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.27.eng: He is virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. He undertakes and trains in the training rules.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.28.pli: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasā anupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.28.eng: He has learned much, and he retains and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.29.pli: ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.29.eng: He has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail. He has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.30.eng: He is well-spoken and has a good voice.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.31.eng: He is generally liked by and pleasing to the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.32.eng: He is capable of instructing the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.33.pli: na kho panetaṃ bhagavantaṃ uddissa pabbajitāya kāsāyavatthavasanāya garudhammaṃ ajjhāpannapubbo hoti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.33.eng: He has never committed a heavy offense against a Buddhist nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.34.eng: He has been fully ordained for at least twenty years.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.35.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ sammannitun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.35.eng: Monks, you may appoint a monk who possesses these eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.6.eng: who has not been appointed through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.8.eng: they have been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.10.eng: if he instructs in the eight important principles, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.11.eng: If he instructs in any other teaching, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.12.eng: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.13.pli: Tena sammatena bhikkhunā pariveṇaṃ sammajjitvā pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā āsanaṃ paññapetvā dutiyaṃ gahetvā nisīditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.13.eng: The monk who has been appointed should sweep the yard, set out water for drinking and water for washing, prepare a seat, get hold of a companion, and then sit down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.13.comm: For the rendering of pariveṇa as “yard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.14.pli: Bhikkhunīhi tattha gantvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.14.eng: The nuns should go there, bow down to the monk, and sit down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.15.eng: The monk should then ask them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.16.comm: “Are you all here” renders samaggāttha, literally, “Are you united”. Sp 2.149: Samaggātthāti sabbā āgatatthāti attho, “Are you united: the meaning is, ‘Have you all come?’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.17.eng: If they say, “We’re all here, venerable,” he should say, “Are you keeping the eight important principles?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.18.eng: If they say, “We are,” he should say, “This is the instruction.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.18.comm: For the meaning of niyyādetabbo in this context, see the usage in the origin story to the next rule, Bu Pc 22:1.9. Sp 2.149: Niyyādetabboti appetabbo … Ovādaṁ aniyyādetvāti eso bhaginiyo ovādoti avatvā, “Niyyādetabbo: should display it. … Ovādaṁ aniyyādetvā: not having said, ‘Sisters, this is the instruction.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.19.eng: If they say, “We’re not,” he should recite the important principles:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.19.comm: Sp 2.149: Osāretabboti pāḷi vattabbā, “Osāretabbo: the Canonical text is to be spoken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20.pli: “Vassasatūpasampannāya bhikkhuniyā tadahupasampannassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kātabbaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20.eng: “A nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should bow down to a monk who was given the full ordination on that very day, and she should stand up for him, raise her joined palms to him, and do acts of respect toward him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20.comm: “Acts of respect” renders sāmīcikammaṁ. Sp 2.149: sāmīcikammanti maggasampadānabījanapānīyāpucchanādikaṁ anucchavikavattaṁ, “Sāmīcikammaṁ means appropriate duties such as giving way, fanning, offering drinking water, etc.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.21.pli: ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.21.eng: This principle is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22.pli: Na bhikkhuniyā abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22.eng: A nun shouldn’t spend the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22.comm: The Pali word behind the translation “monastery” is āvāsa. This refers to the area of the simā, the monastery zone, as established through a legal procedure. This area may be much larger than the space occupied by any actual buildings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.23.pli: ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.23.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.24.pli: Anvaddhamāsaṃ bhikkhuniyā bhikkhusaṅghato dve dhammā paccāsīsitabbā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.24.eng: Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.25.eng: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.26.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.27.pli: vassaṃ vuṭṭhāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi pavāretabbaṃ
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.27.eng: A nun who has completed the rainy-season residence should invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.28.pli: diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.28.eng: what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.29.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.30.pli: garudhammaṃ ajjhāpannāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe pakkhamānattaṃ caritabbaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.30.eng: A nun who has committed a heavy offense must undertake a trial period for a half-month toward both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.30.comm: Heavy offense, garudhamma, here refers to the saṅghādisesa offenses, the offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.31.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.32.pli: dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya sikkhamānāya ubhatosaṅghe upasampadā pariyesitabbā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.32.eng: A trainee nun who has trained for two years in the six rules may seek for full ordination in both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.33.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.34.pli: na bhikkhuniyā kenaci pariyāyena bhikkhu akkositabbo paribhāsitabbo;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.34.eng: A nun may not in any way abuse or revile a monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.35.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36.pli: ajjatagge ovaṭo bhikkhunīnaṃ bhikkhūsu vacanapatho, anovaṭo bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīsu vacanapatho;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36.eng: From today onwards, nuns may not correct monks, but monks may correct nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36.comm: “Correct” renders vacanapatha. For the meaning of this word, see Bhikkhu Sujato, “Bhikkhuni Vinaya Studies”, pp. 73–76.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.37.pli: ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.37.eng: This principle too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.38.pli: Sace “samaggāmhāyyā”ti bhaṇantaṃ aññaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.38.eng: If they say, “We’re all here, venerable,” and he instructs them with another teaching, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.38.comm: It is not entirely clear how this offense comes about, but it must somehow relate to what we find in segment 3.1.17 above. It seems the text here assumes that the nuns reply “no” to the follow-up question in segment 3.1.17 of whether they are keeping the important principles, in which case the appointed monk is supposed to recite them. Only if he does not do so at this point, does he incur an offense of wrong conduct under this rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.39.pli: Sace “vaggāmhāyyā”ti bhaṇantaṃ aṭṭha garudhamme bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.39.eng: If they say, “We’re not all here, venerable,” and he instructs them in the eight important principles, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.40.pli: Ovādaṃ aniyyādetvā aññaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.40.eng: If he does not give the instruction, but he gives them another teaching, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.40.comm: “He does not give the instruction” renders ovādaṁ aniyyādetvā. Sp 2.149: Ovādaṁ aniyyādetvāti eso bhaginiyo ovādoti avatvā “He does not give the instruction: not having said, ‘Sisters, this is the instruction.’” This seems a bit contrived, but in light of segment 3.1.18 above and the origin story to Bu Pc 22:1.9 perhaps it is nevertheless the right interpretation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.1.pli: Adhammakamme adhammakammasaññī vaggaṃ bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ vaggasaññī ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.1.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure and he perceives it as such, and the Sangha of nuns is incomplete and he perceives it as such, then if he instructs those nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.1.comm: The legal procedure in question is the one that gives approval to a monk to instruct the nuns. Sp 2.150: Adhammakammetiādīsu bhikkhunovādakasammutikammaṁ kammanti veditabbaṁ, “Adhammakamme: the legal procedure that gives approval to instruct the nuns should be understood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.2.pli: Adhammakamme adhammakammasaññī vaggaṃ bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ vematiko ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.2.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure and he perceives it as such, and the Sangha of nuns is incomplete but he is unsure of it, then if he instructs those nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.3.pli: Adhammakamme adhammakammasaññī vaggaṃ bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ samaggasaññī ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.2.36.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure and he perceives it as such, and the Sangha of nuns is complete and he perceives it as such, then if he instructs those nuns, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.3.comm: “Testing” renders paripuccha. The basic meaning of paripucchā is “to question” or “to ask”, as used for instance in Bu Pc 71. Often, however, as in the present case, it refers to a teacher questioning his student, in the sense of finding out how much the student knows. In such cases I render the word as “testing”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.4.eng: if he recites when asked to do so;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.4.comm: That osāreti must mean “recite” can be seen from Bu Pc 4:2.3.5 where there is no offense if osārentaṁ opāteti, “he prompts one who is osārentaṁ.” The difference between uddesaṁ deti and osāreti is not clear to me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.6.eng: if he replies when asked a question;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.7.eng: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and the nuns listen in;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.8.eng: if it is to a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.9.eng: if it is to a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.3.12.eng: The training rule on the instruction, the first, is finished.
